# Draft:Mayoral elections in Worcester, Massachusetts in the early 20th century

1901
1902
1903
1904
1905
Democrat John T. Duggan
1906
Democrat John T. Duggan
1907
In December 1907, Republican nominee James Logan was elected mayor of Worcester, unseating incumbent mayor John T. Duggan (a Democrat).
Nominations
On November 21, 1907, Logan accepted the Republican nomination for mayor.
Duggan was re-nominated by Democrats.
Results
Logan received a then-record vote total for a candidate in a contested Worcester mayoral election.
1908
James F. McGovern ran against logan as Dem nominee
1909
1910
1911
1912
1913
John Wilson Armour (manufacturer) was Progressive nominee
1914
In December 1914, ____ was elected, defeating Democratic nominee James Francis Carberry.
;Nominees
*James Francis Carberry (Democratic Party): Liquor License Committee member (since 1903), former state representative (1898), former member of the Worcester Board of Aldermen (1899–1900), former member of the Worcester Common Council from ward 5 (1896–97)
*_____
